item.title: Stubby add a quote by Anne Carson
item.description: "Then a miracle occurred in the form of a plate of sandwiches. Geryon took three and buried his mouth in a delicious block of white bread filled with tomatoes and butter and salt. He thought about how delicious it was, how he liked slippery foods, how slipperiness can be of different kinds. I am a philosopher of sandwiches, he decided. Things good on the inside." -- Anne Carson

item.title: Stubby add a quote by Baudrillard Jean
item.description: "Consumption is not a passion for substances but a passion for the code" -- Baudrillard Jean

item.title: Stubby add a quote by Anne Carson
item.description: "Under the seams runs the pain." -- Anne Carson

item.title: Stubby add a quote by Anne Carson
item.description: "A refugee population is hungry for language and aware that anything can happen." -- Anne Carson

item.title: Stubby add a quote by Anne Carson
item.description: "When they made love Geryon liked to touch in slow succession each of the bones of Herakles' back as it arched away from him into who knows what dark dream of its own, running both hands all the way down from the base of the neck to the end of the spine which he can cause to shiver like a root in the rain." -- Anne Carson

item.title: Stubby add a quote by Anne Carson
item.description: "Lava bread makes you passionate." -- Anne Carson

item.title: Stubby add a quote by Anne Carson
item.description: "Desire is no light thing." -- Anne Carson

item.title: Stubby add a quote by Catullus
item.description: "I hate and I love Why do I, you ask ? I don't know, but it's happening and it hurts" -- Catullus
